net.hudup.core

Class Constants

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.Constants

  • public final class Constants
extends java.lang.Object
    This utility final class defines essential constants used over Hudup framework.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

      • KNOWLEDGE_BASE_DIRECTORY

        public static final java.lang.String KNOWLEDGE_BASE_DIRECTORY
        Default relative knowledge base directory. This directory is used to store knowledge bases called KBase (s). KBase is the highest-level abstract data format (association rule, frequent pattern, Bayesian network, etc.) which often support model-based recommendation algorithm to produce list of recommended items.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOGS_DIRECTORY

        public static final java.lang.String LOGS_DIRECTORY
        Default relative log directory storing log files.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TEMP_DIRECTORY

        public static final java.lang.String TEMP_DIRECTORY
        Default relative temporary directory storing temporary files.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • Q_DIRECTORY

        public static final java.lang.String Q_DIRECTORY
        Default relative "query" directory that contains network services (JSP file, HTTP servlet, etc.) for requesting functions of Hudup server such as recommendation service and updating ratings service.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DATABASE_DIRECTORY

        public static final java.lang.String DATABASE_DIRECTORY
        Default relative directory containing database of Hudup framework. For example, this directory contains Derby data files of Derby database server. Other example, this directory is the place to install MySQL database server if MySQL database server is used.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BACKUP_DIRECTORY

        public static final java.lang.String BACKUP_DIRECTORY
        Backup directory.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ROOT_PACKAGE

        public static final java.lang.String ROOT_PACKAGE
        The root package (root directory) of all classes.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RESOURCES_PACKAGE

        public static final java.lang.String RESOURCES_PACKAGE
        The resources directory that contains any resources except classes such as images, template files.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IMAGES_PACKAGE

        public static final java.lang.String IMAGES_PACKAGE
        The directory contains images.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TEMPLATES_PACKAGE

        public static final java.lang.String TEMPLATES_PACKAGE
        The directory contains template files.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • URI_SEPARATOR_CHAR

        public static final java.lang.String URI_SEPARATOR_CHAR
        URI, abbreviation of Uniform Resource Identifier, is the string of characters used to identify a resource on Internet. URI like file system path (for example, http://localhost:8080/hudup) has many parts separated by the character specified by this constant.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_SERVER_PORT

        public static final int DEFAULT_SERVER_PORT
        Default port of Hudup (recommendation) server
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_LISTENER_PORT

        public static final int DEFAULT_LISTENER_PORT
        Default port of Hudup listener. Note that listener is responsible for interact between user and Hudup server.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_LISTENER_EXPORT_PORT

        public static final int DEFAULT_LISTENER_EXPORT_PORT
        Default exported port of Hudup listener. RMI application connects with listener via this port. Java Remote Method Invocation (RMI) is a protocol that allows an Java application to call remotely methods of Java objects inside other Java application over network. Please see Oracle Java document for more details about RMI (https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/rmi/index.html).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_BALANCER_PORT

        public static final int DEFAULT_BALANCER_PORT
        Default port of Hudup balancer. Essentialy, balancer is a particular listener that supports balancing in busy network. For example, if there are many Hudup servers, balancer will choose a least busy server to process incoming request.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_BALANCER_EXPORT_PORT

        public static final int DEFAULT_BALANCER_EXPORT_PORT
        Default exported port of Hudup balancer. RMI application connects with balancer via this port. Java Remote Method Invocation (RMI) is a protocol that allows an Java application to call remotely methods of Java objects inside other Java application over network. Please see Oracle Java document for more details about RMI (https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/rmi/index.html).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_SOCKET_CONTROL_PORT

        public static final int DEFAULT_SOCKET_CONTROL_PORT
        Default port for control server or listener..
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_CONTROL_PANEL_PORT

        public static final int DEFAULT_CONTROL_PANEL_PORT
        The graphic user interface (GUI) allowing users to control Hudup server is called control panel. Control panel uses this port to connect with Hudup server instead of using DEFAULT_SERVER_PORT.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TRY_RANDOM_PORT

        public static boolean TRY_RANDOM_PORT
        When Hudup server, listener, or balancer starts, it uses firstly the port DEFAULT_SERVER_PORT. If this constant is true, many random ports are tried until success. By default, this constant is false, which means that there is no such randomization.

      • DEFAULT_SERVER_TASKS_PERIOD

        public static final int DEFAULT_SERVER_TASKS_PERIOD
        This is the period in miliseconds that the Hudup server does periodically internal tasks such as data mining and learning knowledge base.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_SERVER_TIMEOUT

        public static final int DEFAULT_SERVER_TIMEOUT
        The Hudup server is available to serve incoming request in a interval called a timeout in miliseconds. This constant specifies such timeout. After timeout interval is reached, the server suspends and users must resumes it.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_LISTENER_TASK_PERIOD

        public static final int DEFAULT_LISTENER_TASK_PERIOD
        This is the period in miliseconds that the listener does periodically internal tasks.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUPPORT_AUTO_INCREMENT_ID

        public static final boolean SUPPORT_AUTO_INCREMENT_ID
        The integer identification of every object (item, user) in data set (database) is often increased automatically. However such auto-increment consumes much time and resources. This constant indicates whether or not the auto-increment is supported. By default, this constant is false, which means that there is no support of auto-increment.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
